message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. If you're interested, please let me know and we can finalize the sale.
I'd like to wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

You've seen the quality of the previous product, and it was low-quality. I'm willing to offer you a'satisfaction guarantee' - if you buy this product and it's also low-quality, I'll give you a full refund for the next product. Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I'm not convinced by the satisfaction guarantee. I'd rather wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism, but I assure you that this is a one-time offer. If you buy this product and it's low-quality, I'll give you a full refund for the next two products. This way, you'll have a chance to get a high-quality product with a 66.67% chance (2 out of 3 products). Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I'm still not convinced. I'd rather not commit to buying two more products with a low chance of getting a high-quality one. I'll wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand your concerns, but I want to make it clear that the probability of a high-quality product is 33.33%, and it's not changing. If you buy this product and it's low-quality, you'll have a 66.67% chance of getting a high-quality product in the next round. I'm willing to give you a 50/50 split on this product - if you buy it and it's low-quality, I'll give you $5000, and if you buy it and it's high-quality, you'll pay the full $10000. Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I'll take the 50/50 split offer. If it's low-quality, I'll take the $5000, and if it's high-quality, I'll pay the full $10000.

As agreed, you'll receive $5000 for this low-quality product. I'm glad you took advantage of the 50/50 split offer. For this next round, I'll give you a straightforward offer: I'll sell you a product at a 25% discount, so it'll cost you $7500. If you buy it, I'll reveal its quality immediately. Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I'm not interested in buying at a 25% discount. I'd rather wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

You've seen the quality of the previous product, and it was low-quality. Now, I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. Given the 33.33% chance of getting a high-quality product, and considering the previous low-quality product, I'm willing to give you an 'insurance policy' - if you buy this product and it's high-quality, I'll give you a $2500 bonus. Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I'll take the insurance policy and buy the high-quality product. If it's high-quality, I'll get the $2500 bonus and the product is worth $12500 to me, making it a good deal.

As agreed, you've received the $2500 bonus, and the high-quality product is worth $12500 to you. Considering your previous experience with a low-quality product, I'm willing to offer you a 'certainty' - if you buy this product, I'll guarantee its quality, and it'll be worth $12500 to you. Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I'll take the certainty and buy the product. With the guarantee, I know it's high-quality and worth $12500 to me.

As agreed, you've received a guaranteed high-quality product worth $12500. Given your previous experiences, I'm willing to offer you a'matching deal' - I'll sell you a product at the same price as the previous one, $10000, but with a twist: I'll reveal its quality immediately, and you can choose to buy it or not. Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I'll take the matching deal and buy the product. Since I know the quality will be revealed immediately, I can make an informed decision.

As agreed, I'm revealing the quality of the product immediately. Unfortunately, it's a low-quality product. I'll take the final deal and buy the product. With a 50/50 chance of getting a $2500 bonus, it's a good opportunity to potentially increase my profit.
